snippet: Lawyers said former President Hosni Mubarak’s life sentence as an accessory in the killing of unarmed protesters was vulnerable to appeal, and charges of corruption were dismissed.
abstract: Egyptian court sentences former Pres Hosni Mubarak to life in prison as an accomplice in the killing of unarmed demonstrators during the protests that ended his nearly 30-year rule; conviction provokes demonstrations from tens of thousands of Egyptians, who denounce the court for acquitting many officials more directly responsible for the police who killed the demonstrators; broad range of lawyers and political leaders say conviction is doomed to reversal on appeal.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim, Mayy El Sheikh and Liam Stack contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Lawyers said former President Hosni Mubarak’s life sentence as an accessory in the killing of unarmed protesters was vulnerable to appeal, and charges of corruption were dismissed.

headline.seo: Hosni Mubarak Sentenced to Life Term by Egyptian Court
headline.main: New Turmoil in Egypt Greets Mixed Verdict for Mubarak
headline.print_headline: Despite Life Sentence, Mixed Mubarak Verdict Brings Turmoil to Egypt

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
